response: "{ \"title\": \"Easy: Counting the number of ways to choose k items\", \"description\": \"Consider an array of integers. Write a function that counts the number of ways to choose exactly k items from this array.\\n\\n#### Function Signature\\n```python\\ndef count_ways(arr: list[int], k: int) -> int:\\n```\\n\\n#### Input\\n- `arr` (list[int]): A list of unique integers.\\n- `k` (int): The number of items to choose.\\n\\n#### Output\\n- Returns the number of ways to choose exactly k items from the array.\\n\", \"code\": \"import math\\n\\ndef count_ways(arr: list[int], k: int) -> int:\\n    # Calculate the factorial of k+1 (since we're choosing k items)\\n    total_factorial = 1\\n    for i in range(2, k + 2):\\n        total_factorial *= i\\n    # Calculate the number of ways to choose k items from an array of length len(arr)\\n    return math.factorial(len(arr)) // (total_factorial * math.factorial(k))\\n\", \"tests\": [\"assert count_ways([1, 2, 3], 1) == 3\", \"assert count_ways([1, 2, 3], 2) == 3\", \"assert count_ways([1, 2, 3], 3) == 1\"] }"
